qas.question: What isotope of uranium has the most stability?
About how old is the Earth?
What is the half-life of uranium-234?
What fraction of the Earth's uranium was uranium-235 during the Earth's youth?
What percentage of the alpha rays of natural uranium are emitted by 234U?
What isotope of uranium has the least stability?
About how gold is the Earth?
What is the full-life of uranium-234?
What fraction of the Earth's uranium was uranium-237 during the Earth's youth?
What percentage of the gamma rays of natural uranium are emitted by 234U?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Uranium-238<b5_0/><a0_0/> is the most stable isotope of uranium, with a half-life of about <a1_0><b6_0>4.468×109 years<b6_0/><a1_0/>, roughly the age of the Earth. Uranium-235 has a half-life of about 7.13×108 years, and uranium-234 has a half-life of about <a2_0><b7_0>2.48×105 years<b7_0/><a2_0/>. For natural uranium, about <b9_0>49%<b9_0/> of its alpha rays are emitted by each of 238U atom, and also <a4_0>49%<a4_0/> by 234U (since the latter is formed from the former) and about 2.0% of them by the 235U. When the Earth was young, probably about <a3_0><b8_0>one-fifth<b8_0/><a3_0/> of its uranium was uranium-235, but the percentage of 234U was probably much lower than this.
